issue.title: Save gazebo log file for each test in Jenkins

content.raw:
That's a good idea; it may be tricky though.

There's an internal gtest function called [GetCurrentExecutableName](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/6f357235d464f26f5ffc61f90e17e67f788703f5/test/gtest/src/gtest.cc?at=default#cl-376), but is not externally accessible.

We could call it if we modify our internal implementation of gtest.

Or we could use the test case and test name, which are part of the public API. These test names would take some wrangling to make them file names though. For example`INTEGRATION_non_default_world` runs the following tests:
~~~
PhysicsEngines/NonDefaultWorld.Load/0
PhysicsEngines/NonDefaultWorld.Load/1
PhysicsEngines/NonDefaultWorld.Load/2
PhysicsEngines/NonDefaultWorld.Load/3
~~~
content.html:
That's a good idea; it may be tricky though.

There's an internal gtest function called GetCurrentExecutableName, but is not externally accessible.

We could call it if we modify our internal implementation of gtest.

Or we could use the test case and test name, which are part of the public API. These test names would take some wrangling to make them file names though. For exampleINTEGRATION_non_default_world runs the following tests:

PhysicsEngines/NonDefaultWorld.Load/0
PhysicsEngines/NonDefaultWorld.Load/1
PhysicsEngines/NonDefaultWorld.Load/2
PhysicsEngines/NonDefaultWorld.Load/3
